value.title: Nvidia CEO talks Q4 earnings results, says AI is driving cloud adoption
value.excerpt: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang joined Jim Cramer on "Mad Money" to discuss the chipmaker's performance from the latest quarter, comment on the chip shortage impacting industry and give his outlook for the artificial intelligence market.

value.title: DBS Offers Facial Recognition For SMB Customers
value.excerpt: Small and medium-sized business (SMB) owners in Singapore will be able to use facial recognition to access their DBS Bank accounts.

value.title: Biden should double down on Trump’s policy of promoting AI within government
value.excerpt: The current administration should not only maintain the policy of promoting government use of AI, it should make it a priority.

value.title: How to shift your AI focus from accuracy to value

value.title: Bollywood movies continue to associate beauty with fair skin, AI study finds
value.excerpt: Computer scientists from Carnegie Mellon University used NLP to analyze how Bollywood and Hollywood movies reflect social biases.

value.title: Driverless bus hits streets of Malaga in southern Spain
value.excerpt: A new driverless electric bus has begun operating in the southern Spanish city of Malaga, in a project presented as a first in Europe.

value.title: Featurespace Touts Breakthrough In Machine Learning For Anti-Fraud Systems
value.excerpt: Featurespace said its new product for the payments industry provides a “deeper layer of defense to protect consumers from scams, account takeover" and fraud.

value.title: Ataccama acquires data visualization startup Tellstory
value.excerpt: Ataccama acquired TellStory to add data vizualization tools to an expert systems platform for managing large amounts of data.

value.excerpt: MorphAIs is a new VC out of Berlin, aiming to leverage AI algorithms to boost its investment decisions in early-stage startups. But there’s a catch: it hasn’t raised a fund yet. value.title: Cloudera aims to fast track enterprise machine learning use cases with Applied ML Prototypes
value.excerpt: Cloudera's AMPs don't replace what data scientists do but give them a starting-off point so they can focus on the code, nuances, and iterating for the business use case.

value.title: Google and MongoDB double down on cloud alliance with deeper Atlas integrations
value.excerpt: Google and MongoDB expand alliance to make it simpler for developers to consume a wider range of backend cloud services.

value.title: Boosted by the pandemic, meeting transcription service Otter.ai raises $50M

value.title: Artificial Intelligence: Leveling The Business Playing Field
value.excerpt: Covid-19 has catalyzed the accelerated adoption of AI-based business analytics, workflow and process automation.

value.title: If I Could Force Executive Leaders To Learn One Thing About AI, What Would It Be?
value.excerpt: In my role over the last 10 years, I have spoken to countless executive leaders about how to leverage AI in their organizations. In most cases, the leaders are starting new AI initiatives or have been assigned to lead a new AI organization.

value.title: This Startup Just Raised $123 Million To Develop A New Way To Find Medicine
value.excerpt: The traditional approach to developing new drugs is to focus on a single target - a molecule within the body that is essential for a disease to take hold. Hitting this target - by either helping or hindering how it works - is one of the main ways that new medicines are discovered.

value.title: Mobileye partners with Lohr and Transdev to develop self-driving shuttles
value.excerpt: Mobileye announced that it's partnering with Lohr and Transdev to develop self-driving shuttles for public transportation.

value.title: Top five artificial intelligence predictions for 2021
value.excerpt: Here are five predictions on what we should expect to see in AI in 2021: 1. Something’s going to give around AI governance. Though regulation hasn’t reached a boiling point yet, AI governance will continue to be a hot topic in 2021.

value.title: Teaneck just banned facial recognition technology for police. Here's why
value.excerpt: Teaneck banned the usage of facial recognition software following widespread criticism of the technology wrongfully targeting people of color.
